definition: to find out/to search out/to uncover/to discover
to search/to look for/to seek

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: I often hanker after a little peace and respite from confusion, but it is really hard to come by.
sentences.chinese: 我常想在纷扰中寻出一点闲静来，然而委实不容易。

sentences.english: We’re trying to tap into a natural pathway involved in this kind of biology.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在试着寻出参与这种生物学现象的自然途径。

definition: to search/to look for/to seek
to rummage/to look through/to leaf through
to collate and examine critically (texts etc)
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to reckon/to infer/to imagine
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
to uncover
to clarify/to distinguish/to elucidate
to seek an answer/to look for an explanation/to explain/explanation
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency
affair/matter/thing/business/articles/goods/materials/thing/stuff/person (derog.)
to deduce/to infer/an implication/same as 推演
see 看破[kan4 po4]
to investigate
to explain the facts/to defend against an accusation
providential good luck/a narrow escape
